contents.content: Once there was a Lion in the jungle who used to kill 2-3 animals daily for his meal. All animals went to him to tell, that daily one of them will come to him for his meal.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-lion-and-the-rabbit-story-in-english-300x201.jpg
So, the Lion agreed and this started going for many days. One day, it was Rabbit’s turn. When he was on his way he saw a well.
Now he plans to kill the lion and save himself. He went to the lion and told him that, there is another lion who claims to be more powerful than him.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-lion-and-the-rabbit-story-pictures-300x206.jpg

Then the lion asks the rabbit to take him to that lion. The rabbit takes him to the well and said he lives here. When the lion looked in the well he saw his own reflection and jumped in the well and dies.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-lion-and-the-rabbit-story-300x205.jpg
Moral: Wisdom wins might.
One day a hunter sets a net to catch birds and placed grains and rice over the net. After some time a flock of pigeons comes by and start eating grains and get caught in the net.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-hunter-and-the-pigeons-story-300x225.jpg
After some time they started losing hope, then their leader asks them to fly together up in the sky. They did as they were told and carried the net away.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-pigeons-and-the-hunter-story-300x167.jpg
The hunter runs after them but they flew away to their friend’s mouse hole. Then the mouse cuts the net and freed the pigeons.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-wise-pigeons-and-the-hunter-story-300x167.png
Moral: Unity is strength.
Once there were two friends who were crossing the jungle. After some time they saw a bear coming towards them.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/two-friends-and-the-bear-story-300x220.jpg
Then, one of the friends quickly climbed the nearby tree and the other one did not know how to climb the tree. So he lays down on the ground holding his breath.
The bear reaches near him and sniffs him in the ear. After some time bear left the place, thinking the man is dead.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-bear-and-two-friends-story-300x172.jpg
Now the other friend climbs down and asked his friend, what did bear said to him in his ear? He replied,” to be safe from the fake friends.”
Moral: Beware of fake friends.

name: The Crow and the Peacock – Who is Happy?

contents.content: Once there was a crow who wishes to be colorful and beautiful like other birds. He then went to the parrot and shared his thoughts.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/who-is-happy-story-300x218.jpg
But parrot said peacock is most beautiful bird so talk to him. Then the crow went to the peacock and told him about his looks.
Then the peacock replied,” You are the luckiest bird that has been never caged in life and we because of our beauty stay caged, and you are always free.”
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-peocock-and-the-crow-story-300x195.jpg
After listening to this, crow realized his mistake and thanked God for making him like this and he flew away happily.
Moral: Never compare yourself to others. Be happy with what you have and what you are.

name: The Ant and The Grasshopper Story

contents.content: https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-ant-and-the-grasshopper-moral-story-300x180.jpg

Once on a bright summer’s sunny day, a Grasshopper was singing then he saw an Ant working hard to collect food, the grasshopper said, “Why do you work so hard in summers? Summers are for fun, relaxation and enjoyment. Come let us sing and enjoy”.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-grasshopper-and-ant-story-moral-300x158.jpg
But Ant said, “I am collecting food for the winters and I recommend you to do the same.”
Grasshopper said, “We have got plenty of food at present. Why bother about winter now?”.
The Ant ignored him and went on its way.
When the winter came grasshopper had no food to eat.
He saw that Ant and begged for food, but she said, “When I worked hard, you enjoyed”.
Then grasshopper learned his lesson the hard way.
Moral: Work hard so you can get the benefits tomorrow.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-boy-who-cried-wolf-moral-249x300.jpg
Once upon a time, there was a boy who had a duty to look after a flock of sheep. The used to lie for his fun.
One day he started shouting, “Wolf, Wolf, Wolf”, on hearing this villager ran towards him for his help.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-boy-who-cried-wolf-300x136.jpg
But when the villagers reached he was laughing on them as there was no wolf.
He was lying and making a fool out of the villagers. This continued for some days.
And finally, one day, a wolf really came and shouted again, nobody came and as a result, the boy was killed by the wolf.
There was no one to blame but him.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-boy-who-cried-wolf-story-meaning-300x119.jpg
Moral: Never lie, no matter how bad the situation is.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-ugly-duckling-story-300x169.jpg
A long time ago, a farmer had a duck, which laid 4 eggs. After a few days, all eggs hatched.
Three ducklings looked like their mom and the fourth one looked different. It was big and grey.
All other ducklings started making fun of him, as they started calling him ugly.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Ugly-Duckling-short-story-300x200.jpg
After some days the sad duckling ran away to a river nearby. There he saw a beautiful white swans.
After seeing their beauty he wanted to drown in the river. But when he looked at his reflection in the river, he realized he was not an ugly duckling but a beautiful Swan!
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/the-ugly-duckling-252x300.jpg
Moral: You are beautiful just the way you are.

name: The Little Red Riding Hood Short Story

contents.content: https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/the-little-red-riding-hood-short-story-300x171.jpg
Once upon a time, there was a girl who lives with her mom in a hut near the forest. She always wears a  red riding hood while going out.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/little-red-riding-hood-story-with-pictures-300x169.jpg
One day she went to see her grandmother and on her way, she met a wolf.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/the-little-red-riding-hood-story-300x159.jpg
The Wolf asked where are you going? She said, ” I am going to see my granny, she lives behind that hill.” After listening this wolf got a wicked idea.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/little-red-riding-hood-story-images-300x142.jpg
The wolf ran to granny’s house and swallowed her up.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/the-little-red-riding-hood-girl-story-300x140.jpg
Then he wore granny’s clothes and got into granny’s bed.  After some Little Red Riding Hood reached granny’s house.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/story-picture-300x133.jpg
She saw the wolf lying in her granny’s bed.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/the-little-red-riding-hood-story-300x225.jpeg
She asked Oh granny, what big eyes you have!
The wolf said,” So that I can see you better,”
She asked,” Granny what big ears you have!
Wolf said,” So that I can hear you better.”
She asked,” Granny what big nose you have!
Wolf said,” So that I can smell you better.”
She again asked,” Granny what big teeth you have!
Wolf said,” So that I can eat you better.”
Then she got scared and starting shouting for help. Help Me! Help Me! The woodsman was chopping the trees heard the scream and ran toward to help her.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/little-red-riding-hood-fables-300x181.jpg
He ran to the house and saw the wolf attacking the girl.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/the-little-red-riding-hood-fable-300x135.jpg
He hit the wolf over the head and this made the wolf open his mouth and shout. And the granny jumped out!
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/red-riding-hood-wolf-story-300x211.jpg
The wolf ran away and the girl never saw that wolf again. The grandmother and the Red Riding Hood Girl had a great lunch and long chat.
Moral: Be brave

name: The Monkeys and The Cap Seller Story

contents.content: https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/the-monkeys-and-the-cap-seller-story-2-300x169.jpg
Once a cap seller was going to sell his caps in a village market. He was going through the forest and was carrying a basket of red caps on his head.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/monkey-and-cap-seller-story-with-pictures-300x170.jpg
He got tired in the heat of the sun and thought of lying down under the tree for some time. He put his basket on the ground and fall asleep.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/monkey-and-cap-seller-story-ppt-300x175.jpg
There were monkeys on that tree, they came down and one by one took all the caps from the cap seller’s basket. Then they climbed onto the tree.
When the cap seller woke up, he was shocked to see his basket empty. He searched for his caps everywhere. To his surprise, he saw the monkeys were wearing them.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/mokey-and-cap-seller-300x116.jpg
He thought for a while and he started throwing his cap down and monkeys did so.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/mokey-and-cap-seller-story-with-pictures-300x201.jpg
The cap-seller collected all his caps and put them back in his basket and went away happily.
https://shortstorylines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/monkey-and-cap-seller-story-in-english-300x203.jpg
Moral: We should deal with wisdom in tough situations because wisdom helps during difficult times.
